description.narrative: The Right to Grow – Power of Voices partnership which aims to set the basis for all children under 5 to be well-nourished and thereby able to reach their full potential. Max Foundation Bangladesh is the Bangladesh country lead in the Right to Grow partnership and besides the consortium coordination Max Foundation will, together with local partners, strengthen CSO’s capacity in their grassroots advocacy efforts towards ensuring that the voices and needs of especially children under 5 are heard. Activities will include facilitation, capacity building and technical support to the actors in WASH, nutrition, and primary healthcare in communities.

title.narrative: Representative and empowered civil society organisations (CSOs) effectively navigate the civic space to advocate for leadership and good governance to prevent undernutrition
SCS032 - # of times that CSOs succeed in creating space for CSO demands and positions through agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or creating space to engage subnational level

description.narrative: The number of times the government, private sector, or other CSOs (if L&A targets) include: *Policy procedures and decision-making processes become inclusive to (the concerns, rights and ambitions of) specific societal groups represented by CSOs * Targeted actors adopt CSO terminology, rhetoric and framing * Targeted actors place CSO issues on the agenda

comment.narrative: CSOs and CBOs working with nutrition and WASH initiatives were found scattered and no such cases were reported on agenda setting, influencing the debate and/or creating space to engage national level etc. Thus the quantitative value is zero.

Total 160 times by 2025 will be empowered and to be able to voice the needs and concerns of the communities, negotiate their inclusion into the local government planning documents (planning, open budgeting and agenda setting, representation of different committees, etc.) and hold respective authorities accountable in their programming and financial planning.

title.narrative: SCS041 - # of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency at national level

description.narrative: Advocacy initiatives are activities whereby R2G advocacy goals are pursued, for ex. through meetings with decision makers, events, or the sharing of knowledge products.

comment.narrative: Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in advocacy initiative formally. Thus, the quantitative number is zero.

By 2025, total 50 actions / initiatives will take place for both national and local level, where 10 initiatives including CSA-SUN network, public private partnership and provision for budget of U5 Children for protecting malnutrition and infectious diseases, etc. at national level, and 40 initiatives / actions at local level throughout the project period, etc. Partners are targeting to facilitate CSOs in conducting annual WASH & Nutrition integrated lobby and advocacy initiatives in each of the 40 unions where R2G partners have presence.
Note: Depending on the 2022 achievements of the initiatives implemented, actions will be reviewed during midterm and actions for the subsequent years will be determined.

title.narrative: SCS042 - # of advocacy initiatives carried out by CSOs, for, by or with their membership/constituency at sub-national level

description.narrative: Advocacy initiatives are activities whereby R2G advocacy goals are pursued, for ex. through meetings with decision makers, events, or the sharing of knowledge products.

comment.narrative: Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in advocacy initiative formally. Thus, the quantitative number is zero.

In 2022, national level 2 advocacy initiatives, e.g., having CSA-SUN network membership, consultation meeting, sharing of findings with stakeholders, etc., and at local level 8 initiatives will take place related to WASH and Nutrition, and align with selected advocacy issues, etc.
By 2025, total 50 actions / initiatives will take place for both national and local level, where 10 initiatives including CSA-SUN network, public private partnership and provision for budget of U5 Children for protecting malnutrition and infectious diseases, etc. at national level, and 40 initiatives / actions at local level throughout the project period, etc. Partners are targeting to facilitate CSOs in conducting annual WASH & Nutrition integrated lobby and advocacy initiatives in each of the 40 unions where R2G partners have presence.
Note: Depending on the 2022 achievements of the initiatives implemented, actions will be reviewed during midterm and actions for the subsequent years will be determined.

title.narrative: National government and decentralised entities adopt and mainstream an integrated, multisectoral approach to undernutrition in policies, action plans and budget allocations through participatory processes of CSOs
SCS012 - # of laws, policies implemented for sustainable and inclusive development

description.narrative: # of policies, (by-)laws, regulations, regulations, formal guidelines, standards, legal frameworks implemented for sustainable and inclusive development around nutrition and WASH. It concerns policies, laws, by-laws, regulations, regulations, formal guidelines, standards, and legal frameworks which are implemented around nutrition and WASH. By-laws are a regulation made by a local authority or corporation or a regulation made by society to control the actions of its members.

comment.narrative: Government of Bangladesh prepared and implemented a significant number of policies to improve WASH and nutritional status of people, and those docs were revised later on based on necessity, country context and national strategy. At this stage it is almost impossible to define the value of those changes in both quantitatively and qualitatively. Moreover, Right to Grow started its operation in 2021 and the programme does not have any influence on those policies yet. Based on this baseline value is treated as zero.

Following governmental policies for sustainable and inclusive development that are better implemented as a result of CSO engagement: • Inclusion of nutrition as sub-head under Health Sector budget template of Union Parishad (LGI). • Creating budget provision for U5 children for protecting against malnutrition and infectious diseases. • Developed two (02) policies / regulations / strategies adaptive user-friendly info book/guideline on nutrition & WASH sector related issues for respective stakeholders
By 2022 Right2Grow *At least 75% of Union Parishad (30 nos.) will maintain open budget development process based on implementation of local govt (Union Parishad) act 2009, where CSOs will play active roles in support of their community needs related to WASH -Nutrition services. *UDCC (Union Development Coordination Committee) and two Standing Committees (related to a. Sanitation, Water supply and Hygiene (WASH), and b. Education, Health & Family planning) are activated and maintained regular meetings. *Moreover, Upazila and district Nutrition Committees also be activated.

title.narrative: SCS022 - # of laws, policies blocked, adopted, improved for sustainable and inclusive development

description.narrative: # of policies, (by-)laws, regulations, regulations, formal guidelines, standards, legal frameworks blocked, maintained, adopted, improved with concrete and significant changes for sustainable and inclusive development around nutrition and WASH. It concerns policies, laws, by-laws, regulations, regulations, formal guidelines, standards, and legal frameworks which are improved around nutrition and WASH. By-laws are a regulation made by a local authority or corporation or a regulation made by society to control the actions of its members.

comment.narrative:
Government of Bangladesh prepared and implemented a significant number of policies to improve WASH and nutritional status of people, and those docs were revised later on based on necessity, country context and national strategy. At this stage it is almost impossible to define the value of those changes in both quantitatively and qualitatively. Moreover, Right to Grow started its operation in 2021 and the programme does not have any influence on those policies yet. Based on this baseline value is treated as zero.
During baseline conduction we have reviewed 26 policies, legislations, acts, rules, strategies and plans (Refer to chapter-4) related to WASH and Nutrition. We have found the existence of strong national policy framework in both sectors but weakness in effective implementation. In some cases, clear and easily understandable supporting guidelines/ handbooks are absent, such as for local government (Union Parishad) Act 2009 execution.

• Inclusion of nutrition as sub-head under Health Sector budget template of Union Parishad (LGI). • Creating budget provision for U5 children for protecting against malnutrition and infectious diseases. • Developed two (02) policies / regulations / strategies adaptive user-friendly info book/guideline on nutrition & WASH sector related issues for respective stakeholders
By 2022 Right2Grow *At least 75% of Union Parishad (30 nos.) will maintain open budget development process based on implementation of local govt (Union Parishad) act 2009, where CSOs will play active roles in support of their community needs related to WASH -Nutrition services. *UDCC (Union Development Coordination Committee) and two Standing Committees (related to a. Sanitation, Water supply and Hygiene (WASH), and b. Education, Health & Family planning) are activated and maintained regular meetings. *Moreover, Upazila and district Nutrition Committees also be activated.

title.narrative: CBOs effectively mobilise communities around better nutrition and WASH
SCS061 - # of women led CSOs involved in R2G

description.narrative: The indicator concerns the number of women led R2G partners (country and global level – 1st tier) as well as contracted/ implementing CSOs (second tier). 1st tier partners are included in the alliance agreement and have committed to the partnership agreements that are part of each programme proposal. 2nd tier partners are civil society partners who are directly contracted by any of these partners within the scope of the implementation of this programme.

comment.narrative: Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in R2G program. So the quantitative number is zero.
Inception Year
Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in R2G program. So the quantitative number is zero.

As from 2022, the seven R2G partners will add many additional second tier CSOs during implementation: - 250 CSOs from The Hunger Project - 378 CSOs from Max Foundation - 70 CSOs from Action Against Hunger (ACF) - 76 CSOs from World Vision Bangladesh

title.narrative: SCS063 - # of not youth or women led CSOs involved in R2G

description.narrative: The indicator concerns the number of not youth or women led R2G partners (country and global level – 1st tier) as well as contracted/ implementing CSOs (second tier). 1st tier partners are included in the alliance agreement and have committed to the partnership agreements that are part of each programme proposal. 2nd tier partners are civil society partners who are directly contracted by any of these partners within the scope of the implementation of this programme.

comment.narrative: Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in R2G program. So the quantitative number is zero.
Inception Year
Interviewed CSOs were found not involved in R2G program. So the quantitative number is zero.

As from 2022, the seven R2G partners will add many additional second tier CSOs during implementation: - 250 CSOs from The Hunger Project - 378 CSOs from Max Foundation - 70 CSOs from Action Against Hunger (ACF) - 76 CSOs from World Vision Bangladesh

title.narrative: CBOs and CSOs have the legitimacy & capacity to voice the concerns of the marginalized and disempowered
SCS051 - # of women led CSOs with increased L&A capacities

description.narrative: This includes both first and second tier partners with increased L&A capacities. 1st tier partners are included in the alliance agreement and have committed to the partnership agreements that are part of each programme proposal. 2nd tier partners are civil society partners who are directly contracted by any of these partners within the scope of the implementation of this programme.

comment.narrative: R2G did not start implementation in that time, so no qualitative information at the time.
Inception Year
R2G did not start implementation in that time, so no qualitative information at the time.
Consortium of R2G decided to use only the first-tier partners who are directly contracted under R2G project and whose capacity will be assessed. As a result, 7 CSOs with increased L&A capacities.

title.narrative: SCS053 - # of not youth or women led CSOs with increased L&A capacities

description.narrative: This includes both first and second tier partners with increased L&A capacities. 1st tier partners are included in the alliance agreement and have committed to the partnership agreements that are part of each programme proposal. 2nd tier partners are civil society partners who are directly contracted by any of these partners within the scope of the implementation of this programme.

comment.narrative: R2G did not start implementation in that time, so no qualitative information at the time.
Inception Year
R2G did not start implementation in that time, so no qualitative information at the time.
Consortium of R2G decided to use only the first-tier partners who are directly contracted under R2G project and whose capacity will be assessed. As a result, 7 CSOs with increased L&A capacities.
